courses.subject: ENLC
courses.title: Principles and Perspectives of End-of-Life Care
courses.description: Brief Course Description: This course includes an introduction to the overall concept of end of life care and their different perspectives.
courses.enrollment_requirement: For students in MSc Clinical Gerontology and End-of-Life Care
courses.learning_outcomes:
At the end of the course, students should be able to:

• interact with older person/patient, or a patient who is in need of end-of-life care, with a holistic understanding of the medical, functional, psychological, nutritional, financial, social and spiritual issues and how these factors interact

• apply these principles in the planning and auditing of services, as well as policy making

• identify knowledge gaps

• lead quality improvement in care of older people or end of life care
courses.course_syllabus: Brief Course Description: This course includes an introduction to the overall concept of end of life care and their different perspectives.
courses.required_readings: There is no topic-by-topic reading assignments.
courses.recommended_readings: Please refer to the reading list in ***MSc in Clinical Gerontology and End-of-Life Care Handbook.***
